To anyone who has trouble with adding these files to iTunes, do this:
-Google and Download Audacity and Lame for MP3
-Open the program and go to Edit -> Preferences
--Make sure to click the File Formats tab and at the bottom check to see if MP3 Export has Lame 3.98 and if it doesn't, click Find Library and point to it.  Also, make sure that after it is pointed to, you change the bitrate from 128 to 320 to preserve the HQ bitrate.
-Export each song back into the folder and overwrite the song already there. 
--Oh, and a side note, if anyone DOESN'T like the silence at the beginning of track 13, just use Audacity to remove it and export it back into the folder and overwrite.

They will work 100% if you export and overwrite the files.

Cheers

BTW, the last track is not from the album but from a Judas Priest tribute CD.

I had the same problem as mindizzle; only the last two tracks would go into my iTunes library. The way I sorted it out is to open them up in GoldWave, then save them as completely new files. They worked perfectly after that, and they sound excellent.

I think the problem that many users are having (myself included) are with iTunes, not your torrent. When I tried to add the album to my library, only the last two files would should. While I have no idea what caused this, I have found a solution. Download a tool called "MKWACT". It is normally used to convert between lossless files, but with the LAME plugin, it can convert to MP3s aswell. Decode the downloaded files to wav (it will detect an error with the MP3s, just let it do its job) then convert them back to 320k MP3s. They will all then import to iTunes with almost no quality loss. Buy this album, it is awesome (I pre-ordered mine around a month ago, and it should ship when the Uk release comes!)

to make it work on itunes

1.install foolbar20000
2.open the program
3.drag the files that dont work into the big white space area
4.select all and right click on one of them
5.Utilities -> Rebuild MP3 Stream
6.click yes
